III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is allegedly pregnant by a staff member.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 06/12/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist.
I spoke with MDHHS Specialist on 06/12/2023. She reported
Youth A was discharged from Lincoln Center in March of 2023
and is currently at the Juvenile Detention Center. MDHHS
Specialist attempted to interview Youth A on 06/09/2023, Youth A
cussed at her, insisted she was not pregnant, and refused to be
interviewed.
I interviewed Youth A at the Juvenile Detention Center (JDC) on
06/14/2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist and MDHHS
Supervisor. Youth A has been at JDC since 05/22/2023. Youth A
was discharged from Lincoln Center in March of 2023. Youth A
adamantly denied ever having a relationship or being pregnant by
a staff member at Lincoln Center. Youth A denied knowing of any
other youth having an inappropriate relationship with staff while
she was at Lincoln Center. Youth A said Staff 2 made
inappropriate remarks about her butt, and looked at her weird, but
he never did anything to her. She said that staff member made
inappropriate remarks to other youths and would reference his
private part as “monster and gator man.” This was investigated on
05/17/2023 in Special Investigation 2023C0000468, so it was not
addressed again in this investigation.
I interviewed Director at the facility, in collaboration with MDHHS
Specialist. Director was informed last week by Staff 1 of the
allegations. Staff 1 was informed of the allegations last week,
while they were tutoring a youth who was previously placed at the
facility, The youth told Staff 1 that in January 2023 Youth A told
her she was pregnant from a male staff at the facility. She said
Youth A was discharged to her mother in March 2023. Director
was not aware of any reports or concerns regarding staff and
Youth A. Furthermore, there are no reports of any youth being
pregnant at the facility.
2

I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 06/15/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a teacher and tutors the youths
at the facility. Staff 1 said last weeks ago she was tutoring a
former youth that was at the facility, and they told her that Youth A
disclosed to them in January 2023 that she was pregnant. She
said the youth was not specific about who or when this happened.
Staff 1 was not aware of any prior incidents or reports regarding
Youth A having a sexually relationship with staff member while
placed at the facility.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 06/15/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 works as 2nd Shift Supervisor and
has been working at the facility for 15 years. He denied having a
sexual relationship with any current or past youths at the facility,
calling his private parts “monster and gator man, and speaking
inappropriately with any of the youths.
MDHHS Specialist held a predisposition conference held on
07/12/2023 with MDHHS Specialist and Supervisor. MDHHS
Specialist said contact was made with Wayne County's Juvenile
Detention Center’s Medical Director who confirmed Youth A had a
urine test on 05/27/2023 and is not pregnant. There are no
findings by MDHHS Specialist.
Documents reviewed:
• Wayne County Detention Center admission physical exam
for Youth A, dated 05/27/2023. A pregnancy test was
completed for Youth A on 05/27/2023. Pregnancy test was
negative.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is no evidence that
Youth A is pregnant or was having a sexual relationship with Staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
